revised_title: Influence of Poisons on Browning and Comparison of Oxidation by Organic and Inorganic Catalysts
tldr: The author investigates the influence of poisons on the browning reaction in apples and potatoes, and compares the oxidation by organic and inorganic catalysts. The study reveals that browning occurs due to the action of an oxidase ferment on a chromogen present in the pulp cells, and that certain poisons can inhibit or destroy the oxidase ferment.
